results.title: Better life than them
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A group of 15 year olds are interviewed about their attitudes towards school, employment and unemployment and life expectations, peer group acceptance, short and long term prospects of jobs and careers.

results.title: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges

results.brief_description: Educational administrators, teachers, parents and students comment on a range of re-organisation arrangements developed to enable Victorian secondary schools to better respond to todays workforce requirements and the needs of young adults in schooling.

results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.
results.description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. results.title: Achievements in salinity control
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of salinity and its effects on irrigated agriculture. Explains the formation of the water table and the resultant salinity due to poor drainage and evaporation. Focuses on a number of strategies and research developments to combat the problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: The Big Dry
results.brief_description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. This tape examines the effect of the drought in the Mallee region in terms of soil conservation. This area experienced severe soil erosion as farmers were forced to overgraze livestock, in particular sheep.

results.title: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks
results.creator_credit: Dept of Agriculture, Sunraysia, Horticultural Unit

video_links.name: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks

results.brief_description: The establishment of large National Parks in the Mallee have as their objective, the conservation of natural resources. As part of a conservation program, projects include revegetation to support wildlife and conserve the soil and pest control of noxious species such as rabbits. With its largely semi-arid climate, the Mallee, despite suffering from land degradation due to farming and livestock practices, is another of our natural treasures.
